jobs.title: Customer Strategy & Operations
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hiring disclaimer *This is an ongoing role with multiple openings. We regularly hire for this position due to continued team growth and customer expansion.*

The Role

Candid Health is looking to hire multiple Customer Strategy & Operations team members in 2025! Over the past year, this team has grown significantly, and we’re excited to bring on new talent to help drive that momentum forward and support our continued expansion.

In this role, you will own a portfolio of current customers and will be responsible for ensuring that they achieve world-class revenue cycle outcomes. You will work directly with them to understand their challenges (e.g., root causing denials issues, digging into workflow gaps), as well as cross-functionally with other internal teams at Candid to develop solutions. 

This team is at the tip of the spear working with customers helping to make medical billing less painful for everyone involved. If you are excited about what we are building, we’d love to speak with you and see if there is a fit across the team!

What you’ll be doing

  • You’ll interact closely with our current customers, developing intuition around their biggest pain points and thinking of creative ways to address them.

  • You’ll own significant business outcomes and be responsible for driving key metrics for the company.

  • You will be responsible for digging into data (i.e. performing analysis on claims metrics) to identify the root cause of customer issues and provide data informed recommendations for solutions

  • The solutions that you help develop may be both operational (e.g., workflow (re-)design) and/or product-oriented (e.g., automation of manual workflows)

  • Your main goal will be to maximize the value that Candid delivers for our customers (i.e., helping ensure a higher portion of claims get paid, more quickly, and with less effort)

  • You will work closely with other Candid teams, including our RCM, Customer Support, Product, Design and Engineering teams to help solve our customers most valuable and painful problems

  • You’ll play a critical role in shaping our company culture and help make this the best place we’ve ever worked.

Who you are

  • 2-7 years of experience

  • You have a demonstrated track record of expansively owning and driving key business outcomes on high-performing teams.

  • You take pride in your craft and enjoy maintaining a high quality bar, but also believe that “done is better than perfect” and have good intuition around which corners are okay to cut and which aren’t.

  • You enjoy identifying problems and designing product features to address them, and aren’t shy about rolling up your sleeves and getting the work done in the meantime.

  • You have a track record of scaling processes and operations.

  • You’re a clear and concise communicator; you enjoy the challenge of explaining complicated ideas in simple terms, both in-person and in writing.

  • [Optionally] You have experience in healthcare technology and/or healthcare financial services

Pay Transparency

The estimated starting annual salary range for this position is $95,000 - $155,000 USD. The listed range is a guideline from Pave data, and the actual base salary may be modified based on factors including job-related skills, experience/qualifications, interview performance, market data, etc. Total compensation for this position may also include equity, sales incentives (for sales roles), and employee benefits. Given Candid Health’s funding and size, we heavily value the potential upside from equity in our compensation package. Further note that Candid Health has minimal hierarchy and titles, but has broad ranges of experience represented within roles.

Please note: we are looking for employees to join our in-person culture at one of our offices (Denver, San Francisco, or New York). Our ideal weekly schedule is 4 days in-office and 1 day working remotely.

jobs.title: Technical Solutions Consultant (Pre-Sales)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
The Role

As one of Candid Health’s first Solutions Consultants, you will serve as a strategic partner to our Sales team and be at the forefront of our growth. In this role, you will work with our largest prospective customers to ensure we demonstrate clear, measurable value to their revenue cycle pain points using Candid's unique capabilities. You will also be instrumental in building the foundational infrastructure – the processes, tools, and knowledge – that empowers our entire Sales team. If you're passionate about architecting impactful solutions that deliver real value in healthcare, we'd love to hear from you!

What you’ll be doing

  • You will work directly with our Sales team to pitch and close our largest and most strategic enterprise prospects by mapping their business objectives and revenue cycle challenges to Candid's capabilities

  • You will craft and deliver engaging demonstrations that showcase the impact of Candid's solutions

  • You will conduct detailed ROI Analysis for potential prospects in order to present valuable insights on what Candid's product can offer

  • You will partner with our Product, Delivery, and RCM teams to understand prospective customer pain points, and assist in crafting the implementation plan for new customers

  • You will play a crucial role in educating and enabling our Sales team to deeply understand the value proposition and capabilities of our product, empowering them to sell more effectively and confidently

  • As one of the first members of the team, you will help to build a team that is passionate about architecting impactful solutions that deliver real value in healthcare

Who you are

  • You have 5+ years of experience in a Solutions Consulting and/or Pre-Sales Engineering position working with highly complex and customizable products/implementations

    • While not required, it is highly preferred that you have experience working within Digital Healthcare and/or Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) within Healthcare

  • You possess a strong understanding of business drivers and the ability to translate technical capabilities into tangible business outcomes.

  • You have a proven track record of successfully partnering with Sales teams to articulate value and drive customer acquisition.

  • You are adept at understanding complex customer challenges and developing creative, value-driven solutions.

  • You are a strategic thinker with excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of engaging in high-level discussions with prospective customers.

  • You have a proactive and results-oriented individual with a passion for helping customers achieve their goals and enabling your internal partners.

  • Experience in the healthcare technology space, particularly within revenue cycle management and understanding of key performance indicators, is a significant plus.

Pay Transparency

The estimated annual salary range for this position is $200,000 - $226,000 OTE. The listed range is a guideline from Pave data, and the actual base salary may be modified based on factors including job-related skills, experience/qualifications, interview performance, market data, etc. Total compensation for this position may also include equity, sales incentives (for sales roles), and employee benefits. Given Candid Health’s funding and size, we heavily value the potential upside from equity in our compensation package. Further note that Candid Health has minimal hierarchy and titles, but has broad ranges of experience represented within roles.

jobs.title: Business Development Representative
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Role

The Sales team at Candid Health is entering an exciting new phase of expansion following our Series C fundraise. As we move into new markets and scale our operations, we are looking for a Business Development Representative to be at the forefront of this growth.

This is a unique opportunity to directly impact our expansion by building a robust top-of-funnel pipeline for our Account Executive team through strategic and highly targeted outbound efforts. At this stage of our company, you will not only be responsible for executing on our go-to-market strategy but also for helping to shape it. We foster a culture of collaboration, partnership, and a "win fast, fail fast" mentality. If you're eager to drive meaningful impact and help propel Candid into new markets, we'd love to have you on board.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Own the Outbound Strategy: Develop and execute a strategic outbound plan to build a pipeline of new customers across Mid-Market & Enterprise verticals within the Healthcare space. This includes crafting targeted messaging for cold calls, emails, and meetings with physician organizations, MSOs, and PE-backed roll-ups.

  • Generate and Qualify Leads: Use a mix of prospecting tools and your own research to identify and qualify key decision-makers and target companies. You will be heavily involved in the initial discovery and qualification phase of the sales process.

  • Optimize the Sales Playbook: Help build and refine the sales playbook for current and future sellers. Your insights will be critical in developing best practices and scaling our sales efforts as we grow.

  • Partner for Success: Work closely with Account Executives to seamlessly hand off highly qualified leads that translate into new business.

  • Leverage Data: Use Salesforce and other sales automation tools to track and report on key sales metrics. You will manage and prioritize your sales pipeline, maintaining accurate records to ensure effective communication and collaboration within the team.

  • Be a Market Expert: Stay up to date with the latest industry trends, competitor activities, and the needs of our target clients in new markets. Continuously educate yourself on Candid's evolving products and value proposition to effectively differentiate us from the competition.

Who You Are

  • Experienced and Results-Oriented: You have 1-2 years of experience in a strategic outreach role focused on enterprise prospects. You have a proven track record of consistently meeting or exceeding goals.

  • Data-Driven Research Prospector: You strive to understand every angle as you approach crafting meaningful outreach. You understand the KPIs to drive success, and you build outreach from a strategic point of view based on market research.

  • A Confident Communicator: You are comfortable and confident making cold calls and have strong verbal and written communication skills.

  • Disciplined and Resourceful: You exemplify organization, discipline, and resourcefulness in your work, able to manage your time and prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment.

  • Proactive and Curious: You are constantly looking for ways to improve not only your own performance but also the overall sales strategy. You thrive on solving complex problems and finding new opportunities.

Location

We are looking for employees to join our in-person culture in our Atlanta Office. Our weekly schedule is 4 days in-office and 1 day working remotely.

Pay Transparency

The estimated salary range for this position is $120k-$140K OTE. The listed range is a guideline from Pave data, and the actual base salary may be modified based on factors including job-related skills, experience/qualifications, interview performance, market data, etc. Total compensation for this position may also include equity, sales incentives (for sales roles), and employee benefits. Given Candid Health’s funding and size, we heavily value the potential upside from equity in our compensation package. Further note that Candid Health has minimal hierarchy and titles, but has broad ranges of experience represented within roles.

jobs.title: Software Engineer (Senior)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
The Opportunity

We’re looking for a passionate and skilled Senior Software Engineer to join our fast growing engineering teams. In this role, you will be instrumental in revolutionizing healthcare billing products and systems that directly address the needs of our customers. You will contribute to the full software development lifecycle, ensure high scalable, reliable and performance of our products and customer experience. If you thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, are driven by customer outcomes, and are committed to crafting robust and scalable solutions, we would like you to join us! 

What you’ll be doing

  • Conceptualize, design, development, and maintain complex services/platforms/features and develop ownership over large swaths of our product + infrastructure.

  • Collaborate closely with customers, product managers, designers, and cross-functional partners to understand customers’ needs and develop creative ways to address them.

  • Identify, propose and lead architecture and design improvements needed in our products and systems with scalability and reliability as core principles. 

  • Contribute to our engineering + broader company culture and help make this the best place we’ve ever worked.

Who you are

  • You have Bachelors of Science or Bachelors of Art in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math or other similar degree.

  • You have 8+ years of experience in a Software Engineering position. 

  • Experience with programming languages, relevant frameworks, databases and cloud platforms. Familiar with the technologies we currently use is a bonus, but not required: Python, PostgreSQL, Docker, Kubernetes, React, Typescript, Google Cloud Platform, Auth0, Terraform.

  • Proven ability to build high-quality software, and is anchored on customer outcomes and have good intuition around which corners are worth cutting and which aren’t. 

  • Proven ability to own features end-to-end and are comfortable learning new tools or moving across the stack to do so.

  • Customer-first and learner’s mindset, and value teaching others.

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills. Proven ability to explain complicated ideas in simple terms, both in-person and in writing.

Pay Transparency

The estimated starting annual salary range for this position is $195,000 to $250,000 USD. The listed range is a guideline from Pave data, and the actual base salary may be modified based on factors including job-related skills, experience/qualifications, interview performance, market data, etc. Total compensation for this position may also include equity, sales incentives (for sales roles), and employee benefits. Given Candid Health’s funding and size, we heavily value the potential upside from equity in our compensation package. Further note that Candid Health has minimal hierarchy and titles, but has broad ranges of experience represented within roles.

jobs.title: Head of GTM Enablement
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Candid Health:

Candid Health is a fast-growing company that's redefining the way healthcare is delivered. We're passionate about driving innovation in the healthcare and financial services sectors, all while maintaining a relentless focus on the customer. Candid has been in the 95th percentile of growth for startups in 2024 and is rapidly scaling the sales enablement function to support our expanding GTM efforts.

We’re looking for an experienced and results-driven Head of GTM Enablement to help empower our sales, BDR, partners, solution consultants (collectively referred to as the sales team) with the tools, training, and strategies needed to accelerate growth and achieve market leadership. This critical role will work cross-functionally to enhance our go-to-market engine and drive the success of our customer-facing teams.


What You’ll Do:

As the Head of GTM Enablement, you’ll be instrumental in ensuring that all Candid Health’s GTM teams—sales, BDR, partners, solution consultants (collectively referred to as the sales team)—are empowered to operate at their highest potential. Your work will directly influence the efficiency and effectiveness of our entire go-to-market strategy.

  • Sales Enablement:

    • Design and implement a comprehensive onboarding and continuous training program for the sales team, ensuring they are well-versed in our product, market positioning, and unique value proposition.

    • Work with our product and sales engineering team to reflect product updates and changes in our internal and external collateral

    • Develop and maintain sales playbooks to streamline processes and messaging across customer touchpoints.

    • Manage and optimize CRM tools (Salesforce, HubSpot, etc.) to ensure effective tracking, lead follow-up, and closing strategies.

    • Provide competitive analysis and equip the sales team with the insights they need to position Candid Health effectively in the marketplace.

  • Marketing Enablement:

    • Collaborate with marketing to provide high-quality content (case studies, white papers, blog posts) that empowers the sales team to generate and nurture leads.

    • Partner with Marketing to ensure alignment between marketing campaigns and broader GTM strategy, maximizing lead conversion and customer engagement.

    • Partner with the BD team to help execute demand generation strategies to drive lead growth and accelerate sales pipeline development.

  • Product Enablement:

    • Work with the Product and Solution Consulting teams to develop and implement a product training program for all customer-facing teams to ensure deep understanding of product features, benefits, and fit within the market.

  • Technology & Tools:

    • Ensure seamless integration of productivity and collaboration tools (CRM, communication platforms, etc.) across all GTM functions.

    • Continuously evaluate and improve the GTM tech stack, ensuring tools are optimized for efficiency and scalability.

    • Experience deploying content management and learning management systems

What You’ll Need:

  • 7+ years of experience in GTM enablement, sales operations, or a related field at a fast-growing company.

  • Strong experience with sales and marketing tools (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot, Outreach,

  • LMS and CMS etc.) and an ability to integrate systems across departments.

  • Proven track record in developing training programs, sales playbooks, and enablement content that drive measurable improvements in sales performance.

  • Deep understanding of the sales process, lead management, and competitive dynamics in a B2B or healthcare context.

  • Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and effectively across all levels of the organization.

  • Highly organized with a strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously.

  • Comfortable with data-driven decision making, and proficient with reporting and analytics tools (Excel, BI tools, etc.).

  • Strong project management skills and the ability to collaborate cross-functionally across teams and departments.

Nice to Haves:

  • Experience as an individual or leader in sales

  • Experience working in the healthcare domain.

  • Familiarity with customer success and product management processes in a SaaS environment.

  • Prior experience in a high-growth startup or fast-paced scale-up environment.

  • Experience with CRM or sales enablement system administration (Salesforce, HubSpot, etc.).
jobs.descriptionPlain:
About Candid Health:

Candid Health is a fast-growing company that's redefining the way healthcare is delivered. We're passionate about driving innovation in the healthcare and financial services sectors, all while maintaining a relentless focus on the customer. Candid has been in the 95th percentile of growth for startups in 2024 and is rapidly scaling the sales enablement function to support our expanding GTM efforts.

We’re looking for an experienced and results-driven Head of GTM Enablement to help empower our sales, BDR, partners, solution consultants (collectively referred to as the sales team) with the tools, training, and strategies needed to accelerate growth and achieve market leadership. This critical role will work cross-functionally to enhance our go-to-market engine and drive the success of our customer-facing teams.


What You’ll Do:

As the Head of GTM Enablement, you’ll be instrumental in ensuring that all Candid Health’s GTM teams—sales, BDR, partners, solution consultants (collectively referred to as the sales team)—are empowered to operate at their highest potential. Your work will directly influence the efficiency and effectiveness of our entire go-to-market strategy.

 - Sales Enablement:
   
   - Design and implement a comprehensive onboarding and continuous training program for the sales team, ensuring they are well-versed in our product, market positioning, and unique value proposition.
   
   - Work with our product and sales engineering team to reflect product updates and changes in our internal and external collateral
   
   - Develop and maintain sales playbooks to streamline processes and messaging across customer touchpoints.
   
   - Manage and optimize CRM tools (Salesforce, HubSpot, etc.) to ensure effective tracking, lead follow-up, and closing strategies.
   
   - Provide competitive analysis and equip the sales team with the insights they need to position Candid Health effectively in the marketplace.

 - Marketing Enablement:
   
   - Collaborate with marketing to provide high-quality content (case studies, white papers, blog posts) that empowers the sales team to generate and nurture leads.
   
   - Partner with Marketing to ensure alignment between marketing campaigns and broader GTM strategy, maximizing lead conversion and customer engagement.
   
   - Partner with the BD team to help execute demand generation strategies to drive lead growth and accelerate sales pipeline development.

 - Product Enablement:
   
   - Work with the Product and Solution Consulting teams to develop and implement a product training program for all customer-facing teams to ensure deep understanding of product features, benefits, and fit within the market.

 - Technology & Tools:
   
   - Ensure seamless integration of productivity and collaboration tools (CRM, communication platforms, etc.) across all GTM functions.
   
   - Continuously evaluate and improve the GTM tech stack, ensuring tools are optimized for efficiency and scalability.
   
   - Experience deploying content management and learning management systems

What You’ll Need:

 - 7+ years of experience in GTM enablement, sales operations, or a related field at a fast-growing company.

 - Strong experience with sales and marketing tools (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot, Outreach,

 - LMS and CMS etc.) and an ability to integrate systems across departments.

 - Proven track record in developing training programs, sales playbooks, and enablement content that drive measurable improvements in sales performance.

 - Deep understanding of the sales process, lead management, and competitive dynamics in a B2B or healthcare context.

 - Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and effectively across all levels of the organization.

 - Highly organized with a strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously.

 - Comfortable with data-driven decision making, and proficient with reporting and analytics tools (Excel, BI tools, etc.).

 - Strong project management skills and the ability to collaborate cross-functionally across teams and departments.

Nice to Haves:

 - Experience as an individual or leader in sales

 - Experience working in the healthcare domain.

 - Familiarity with customer success and product management processes in a SaaS environment.

 - Prior experience in a high-growth startup or fast-paced scale-up environment.

 - Experience with CRM or sales enablement system administration (Salesforce, HubSpot, etc.).

jobs.title: Experiential Marketing Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

Initially reporting to the Chief Marketing Officer, the Experiential Marketing Lead will expand and elevate our experiential marketing function and provide creative and operational support. Working cross-functionally with our marketing and sales teams, this person will define and implement short and long-term strategies for partner events, VIP/influencer engagements, sponsorships, and experiential marketing. This role is paramount in realizing our ambitious brand elevation and revenue generation strategy for 2026 and beyond.

A successful candidate will be a forward-thinking and hyper-collaborative teammate and will partner with colleagues within our commercial organization to cultivate opportunities to engage and inspire key audiences, including prospects, clients, advisors, and employees.

Responsibilities

  • Conceptualize, plan, and develop a comprehensive experiential marketing strategy, working with senior leadership to address our goals and growth plans across specific audiences and industry segments.

  • Bring “uniquely Candid experiences” and activation events virtually and in-person to life.

  • Provide vision and direction on programming, including creative direction, format, content strategy, speaker preparation, and plan for pre/post-event engagement.

  • Communicate and build relationships with VIP/C-suite speakers and event attendees.

  • Lead the team to source and manage event logistics, including venue selection, contract negotiation, speaker recruitment, vendor management, branding, event production, and programming for events of up to 500 attendees.

  • Build experiential marketing operations function, driving team efficiency and alignment to Key Performance Indicators.

  • Establish plans and budget expectations.

  • Collaborate with key partners to ensure events accomplish shared goals of building and accelerating pipeline, deal progress, existing customer share expansion, and community building

  • Maintain groundbreaking knowledge and insights into the industry and competition to continuously identify potential partnerships and new opportunities

  • Cultivate and maintain Candid Health’s brand and voice through all activations and events

Requirements

  • 6+ years of progressive experience in event marketing and/or experiential marketing (including virtual event experience)

    • Experience in a high growth SaaS Environment is preferred

  • Experience crafting and producing branded experiential activations that have driven measurable earned media attention and buzz

  • B2B event management experience leading proprietary, 3rd party industry or executive events

  • Strong organizational and project management skills to effectively lead multiple partners and projects with tight deadlines

  • Extensive and successful experience with celebrity/VIP management

  • Success in developing strong internal and external relationships

  • Fluency in recent news, cultural trends, and policy changes and able to translate that knowledge into concrete strategic actions

  • Strong imagination, instincts and judgment in transforming complex topics and information into captivating, relevant content

  • Proven acuity to thrive in a fast-paced environment and continuously adapt to new challenges and dynamic priorities, while maintaining professional grace and a sense of humor

  • Strong technical knowledge of a broad range virtual event platforms, virtual event production approaches and modern marketing automation, analytics and technology

  • Exceptional client and vendor management skills

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Excellent technical skills – MS Office (specifically advanced Excel and PowerPoint), virtual event platforms (Hopin, Zoom, others) and integrations to track lead generation (Salesforce.com, HubSpot) and Google Suite

Location

Candid Health is an in-person environment with the expectation that individuals are working 4 days in the office each week (with 1 remote day). Candid Health has offices in San Francisco, Denver, and New York City.

Pay Transparency

The estimated starting annual salary range for this position is $160,000 - $200,000 USD. The listed range is a guideline from Pave data, and the actual base salary may be modified based on factors including job-related skills, experience/qualifications, interview performance, market data, etc. Total compensation for this position may also include equity, sales incentives (for sales roles), and employee benefits. Given Candid Health’s funding and size, we heavily value the potential upside from equity in our compensation package. Further note that Candid Health has minimal hierarchy and titles, but has broad ranges of experience represented within roles.

jobs.title: EDI Enrollments Specialist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
What You’ll Be Doing

  • You’ll prepare and submit applications to configure Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) claims and Electronic Remittance Advice (ERA) through clearinghouse and other payer portals

  • You’ll prepare and submit applications to configure Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT) with payers

  • You’ll initiate investigation with payers regarding provider enrollment denials and errors

  • You’ll review correspondence received from payers and action appropriately for resolution 

  • You’ll work as a liaison between the RCM department and Strategy & Operations team to discuss, investigate, and resolve enrollment tasks

  • You’ll interact with our customers through excellent written and verbal communication

  • You’ll maintain up-to-date and accurate enrollment records within the Candid Health product

  • You’ll meet and maintain KPIs/metrics for production and quality 

  • You’ll maintain working knowledge of workflow, systems, and tools used in the department

  • You’ll maintain HIPAA guidelines 

Who You Are

  • You have at least 2 year of experience in revenue cycle management (for medical billing or within healthcare/healthtech)

  • You may have experience with EDI enrollment, Change Healthcare experience is a plus

  • You have an investigative mindset and you are comfortable running down problems and suggesting actions based on data

  • You are a self starter 

  • You take pride in your craft and enjoy maintaining a high quality bar, but also believe that “done is better than perfect” and have good intuition around which corners are okay to cut and which aren’t.

  • You have excellent oral and written communication skills

  • You have effective multitasking skills

  • You have a positive and cooperative attitude in working and communicating with individuals at all levels of the organization

Pay Transparency

The estimated starting annual salary range for this position is $22-$27 USD per hour. The listed range is a guideline from Pave data, and the actual base salary may be modified based on factors including job-related skills, experience/qualifications, interview performance, market data, etc.
